q1.question: How long does the ISO certification process take?
q1.answer: The duration depends on the company size (units to be certified, number of employees) and process complexity. In practice, the audit team needs at minimum several days but also weeks of work.

q2.question: How much does ISO certification cost?
q2.answer: The certification price depends on the type or ISO systems you want to integrate (a single standard or several integrated standards together). Their complexity combined with the duration of the audit process determines the monetary value.

q3.question: Does MSC Certifications offer consultancy to implement ISO?
q3.answer: No. MSC Certifications, as a certification body, does not offer consultancy for implementing management systems for its clients, to maintain impartiality and compliance with ISO/IEC 17021 requirements. We can explain standard requirements and audit findings, but not build the system for you.

q4.question: Does MSC Certifications offer integrated audits for multiple standards simultaneously?
q4.answer: Yes. When reasonable and possible, we combine auditing of multiple standards into an integrated audit, to avoid duplication and reduce the operational burden for the client.

q5.question: Can I transfer my certificate from another certification body?
q5.answer: Yes, MSC Certifications can accept certificate transfers from other accredited bodies, if certain conditions are met (validity of existing certificate, nonconformity status, audit documentation, etc.). The transfer process is evaluated case by case.

q6.question: Can the audit be conducted remotely (online)?
q6.answer: Yes, in some cases and according to accreditation rules, part of the audit can be conducted remotely, especially for documentation review. Critical on-site activities require physical presence.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: MSC Certifications, Your Questions Answered
faq.intro: At MSC Certifications, we believe clarity builds trust. Below you will find answers to the most common questions about ISO certification, CE Marking and compliance services we offer. If you don't find your question here, don't hesitate to contact us, our team is always ready to help.

q1.question: 1. What does MSC Certifications do?
q1.answer: MSC Certifications is an accredited certification and assessment body by DPA, offering ISO certification, CE Marking and specialized compliance services. We conduct audits, assessments and inspections to ensure your organization meets international standards for quality, safety, environment and legal compliance.

q2.question: 2. What industries do you cover?
q2.answer: We work with clients in all major industries, including: manufacturing, construction, logistics, food industry, hospitality (HORECA), healthcare, IT and public administration.

q3.question: 3. How long does the certification process take?
q3.answer: The duration depends on the size and complexity of your organization and the standard you want to certify.

q4.question: 4. What is the difference between certification and consultancy?
q4.answer: Certification is an independent assessment that confirms your compliance with a standard. Consultancy involves building the system and preparing for certification. MSC Certifications offers only auditing and certification services, not consultancy, to maintain impartiality and compliance with international accreditation rules.

q5.question: 5. Are your certificates internationally recognized?
q5.answer: Yes. All certificates issued by MSC Certifications are internationally accredited by DPA, member of IAF (International Accreditation Forum) and EA (European Accreditation), ensuring global recognition by authorities, clients and tendering bodies.

q1.question: 6. Which ISO standards do you offer?
q1.answer: We offer accredited certification for: ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 22000, ISO 27001, ISO 45001, ISO 22301, ISO 37001, ISO 39001, ISO 50001 and HACCP.

q2.question: 7. Why should my company get ISO certified?
q2.answer: ISO certification demonstrates your commitment to quality, safety and efficiency. It increases client trust, helps with legal compliance, risk reduction and inclusion in public or private tenders.

q3.question: 8. What happens during an ISO audit?
q3.answer: Our auditors review processes, documentation and practical implementation of the standard. The audit identifies strengths and opportunities for improvement. If compliance is complete, the organization receives the official accreditation certificate.

q1.question: 9. What is CE Marking and who is required to have it?
q1.answer: CE Marking is mandatory for many products sold within the European Economic Area (EEA). It shows that the product complies with EU safety, health and environmental regulations. We offer audits and assessments for compliance, to help you achieve legal requirements.

q1.question: 10. What is the Energy Efficiency Program?
q1.answer: A structured approach to analyze and reduce energy consumption in your processes. We conduct energy audits and identify opportunities for cost savings and CO₂ reduction.

q2.question: 11. What is a Technological Card?
q2.answer: A technical document that defines the production process, materials and equipment needed for quality control and production uniformity.

q3.question: 12. What is a Professional Card?
q3.answer: A certifying document of role and professional qualifications, that defines training, experience and capacity of the holder according to legal standards and occupational health and safety.

q4.question: 13. Do you offer staff training?
q4.answer: Yes. We develop role-based and competency training, in compliance with ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001, to improve performance, safety and compliance.

q5.question: 14. Do you perform equipment and technological line assessments?
q5.answer: Yes. We conduct inspections and technical assessments of production lines, machinery and equipment to assess condition, efficiency and safety, essential for modernization or insurance.

q1.question: 15. How can I request a quote for certification or service?
q1.answer: Simply fill out the contact form or call us. Our team will prepare a personalized quote based on your organization's size, scope and standard.

q2.question: 16. What happens after receiving the certificate?
q2.answer: We conduct annual surveillance audits to ensure compliance continues. Certificates are valid for 3 years, after which a new recertification audit is performed.

q3.question: 17. Do you operate internationally?
q3.answer: Yes. Although based in Albania, MSC Certifications offers services throughout the region and beyond, through a network of internationally accredited auditors.

q4.question: 18. How can I know which ISO standard or compliance service my business needs?
q4.answer: If you're not sure, our team will analyze your organization's activities, risks and objectives and recommend the most suitable standard.

hero.title: CE Marking: Demonstrate Product Compliance for the EU Market
hero.subtitle: CE Marking is a mandatory conformity mark that enables products to be legally sold in the European Economic Area (EEA). By affixing the CE mark, the manufacturer declares that the product complies with all applicable EU safety, health, and environmental protection requirements outlined in relevant directives and regulations.

whatIs.title: What Is CE Marking?
whatIs.description1: CE (Conformité Européenne) Marking is a legal declaration by the manufacturer that a product meets the essential requirements of all applicable EU legislation. It is not a quality mark but a regulatory compliance requirement.
whatIs.description2: CE Marking allows for the free movement of products within the EU and EEA and demonstrates that a product has undergone appropriate conformity assessment procedures.

roleBox.title: Our Role as a Certification Partner
roleBox.description: MSC Certifications conducts assessments and audits as part of the CE conformity route, depending on the applicable directive (e.g., Machinery Directive, Medical Device Regulation).

benefits.title: Benefits of CE Marking for Manufacturers

benefit1.title: Legal Access to EU/EEA Markets
benefit1.description: CE Marking is mandatory for many regulated products. Without it, legal sale or distribution within the EU/EEA is not permitted.

benefit2.title: Confidence from Consumers and Authorities
benefit2.description: The CE mark assures buyers and regulators that the product meets essential safety and performance criteria.

benefit3.title: Simplified Audits Through Harmonized Standards
benefit3.description: Products compliant with harmonized European standards benefit from easier conformity assessments and market surveillance audits.
